adjective.description: Existing or occurring before in time or order.
examples: she looked tired after her exertions of the previous evening
tickets will be sold on the same basis as in previous years

adjective.description: Overly hasty in acting or in drawing a conclusion.
examples: I admit I may have been a bit previous

phrases: he seemed to have been in good health previous to the fatal injury
I have no knowledge of any of the family previous to them.
Everything he'd written previous to that was pretty much doodling.
And just to rub salt into the wounds of those envious of her, previous to joining Irish Distillers she was on the tasting panel at Guinness.
origin: Early 17th century: from Latin praevius going before (from prae before + via way) + -ous.
